raw_comment:
What we notice:
-There's a substantially lower number of older people who say the world is getting better
-The overall trend is that there is a larger percentage of 15-24 year old who say the world is getting better, whereas only about 35% of 40+ think the world is getting better
-More developing countries are higher up 
-Indonesia is the most optimistic and Brazil and Mali are the least
-South American countries, older people say that it's getting worst
-Not a lot of European or North American countries
-25-39 year olds & people under 15 are not included

What we wonder:
-Why these countries?
-What stood out among these countries that they chose to make the graph?
-How would the graph change if more ages were included?

Titles: "Where the Millennials at?", "Are we doomed according to the Baby Boomers ?", "Is there hope for gen-z?", "40+ year olds prayin on our downfall"
ace_sentences: There is a substantially lower number of older people who say that the world is getting better.
The overall trend is that a larger percentage of 15-24 year olds say that the world is getting better.
About 35% of people who are 40 years old or older think that the world is getting better.
More developing countries are high in the graph.
Indonesia is the most optimistic country in the graph.
Brazil is one of the least optimistic countries in the graph.
Mali is one of the least optimistic countries in the graph.
In South American countries, older people say that the world is getting worse.
The graph does not include many European countries.
The graph does not include many North American countries.
The graph does not include 25-39 year olds.
The graph does not include people who are under 15 years old.
I wonder why these countries are in the graph.
I wonder what stood out among these countries.
I wonder why the creators chose these countries for the graph.
I wonder how the graph would change if it included more age groups.
One possible title is: Where the Millennials at?
One possible title is: Are we doomed according to the Baby Boomers ?
One possible title is: Is there hope for gen-z?
One possible title is: 40+ year olds prayin on our downfall.
